Summary Heading: Nice little Blast from the Past
Summary: Excellent for the price.  This was a typical little motel right out of the 1950's/1960's.  It's nothing fancy AT ALL but it is super clean and the grounds and pool are pretty darn well kept.  It's within walking distance to many places including Katella Deli which has a great breakfast and bakery.  It's also conveniently located close to the freeway and you really can't beat the price. The room was just fine to take a rest between destinations and to sleep at night.  I would definitely recommend it.

We've been staying here for 5 years or so and absolutely love this place.  Gorgeous pool and courtyard, large rooms and wonderful price.  Can walk to many, many restaurants and jump on any freeway and be where ever you need to be in minutes.

I have stayed at Don's on many occasions. My main requirement for any hotel/motel is cleanliness. Don's pays very close attention to this. Rooms a extremely basic, no frills, but cleanliness, price and location (to a certain extent) are great. I will stay again, and recommend you don't pass Don's by if you want value.

Summary Heading: Ballin' on a Budget at Don's!
Summary: We LOVE this place. Over the years, we have stayed here dozens of times. First of all, it's super clean. I feel like you see people cleaning all the time! The rooms are simple, but spotless. The pool is crystal clean. Second best of all is the kitschy quaintness of this place! It's like a little trip back to 1975. I hope they never get rid of their neon sign! If you stay here, you can walk over to the Starting Gate Night Club a couple blocks away, drink & dance the night away, then walk back to your hotel room. It's perfect! See you again, soon, Don's Turf Motel!! We love you!!

My boyfriend and I stayed there this past weekend. Very affordable,clean, and staff is friendly. We’ve stayed in several places in Long Beach and Anaheim and this is the best one. We’ve decided this will be our place to get away.

This is a great "stop over" motel.  It is clean and quiet.  It is family friendly and with a sparkling pool in the center courtyard.  All of the rooms have sliding glass doors that open to the pool.  It is across the street from the race track.  Be sure to bring your own shampoo and a hair dryer.
Room tip: If you want to use the pool, get a room downstairs

Summary: I found this place because I love horse racing -- it is about 200 yards down the street from Los Alamitos Race Course, a down-to-earth, fun track that deserves more fans. Not being a travel expert, I only know this: if there is a better deal for a simple, well-kept, quiet little motel in a 50-mile radius of this place, I don't know where it would be. Don's is completely comfortable, and usually has vacancies. Pristine pool too. It's down the street from the best deli in Orange County - Katella Deli; it is a half-mile from one of the best seafood spots in the area - the Original Fish Company (famous clam chowder!); and, if you're like me and go nuts for exotic food, it's within striking distance of the great Vietnamese and Indian communities in Garden Grove and Artesia
Room tip: Bathtubs are on upstairs floor only -- otherwise, rooms are similarly good

Summary: Very Good hotel!Staff The room was always clean, and so was the hotel in general. It is basic, but excellent value for the price. The beds are comfy and the shower pressure is good. The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and always happy to help.

I had family in town and recommend they stay close by.  I needed them away from the trashy motels on Beach and in a decent safe location.  Don's Turf Motel's prices are not listed online so I called for pricing.  Surprisingly the rates were less than $90/night for 2 double beds.  My family booked a room.   Pros - Friendly family run business  - cheap affordable rates - clean - newly carpeted  Con - tiny bit of mold in the fridge  Family said they would definitely book here again.

Came for horse races & didn't want to drive home. Holiday weekend...Very surprised, clean and nice a lot nicer than the big chain hotels. comfortable beds real good for the price won't be disappointed me and my wife will stay here again.

My family and I stayed here for a whole week (week of July 4th) and found it delightful!  We've stayed at Don's Turf Motel before, but we were amazed at their rooms!  They have been upgraded since our previous stay a couple of years ago.  We had to be out of our home while work was being done and this was such a nice option!  Although, they don't have as many amenities as some of the larger hotels in the area, the staff friendliness and the quality that we get make it more than worth it.    Our rooms were clean and well maintained during our stay.  The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of towels, we even were able to get some extra towels.  Although our room didn't have everything we needed, I talked to the woman at the front desk and I was given a hair dryer and a

After reading other reviews, I decided to give this place a try. I'm glad I did. It ain't fancy! But, it is clean, quiet and inexpensive. Since I work in the area but live out of the area, I needed a clean, quiet and economical place to stay 3 or 4 nights a week. This place works out ok. No cable TV or internet but, management is very accommodating. I have stayed there 3 or 4 times now and, so far, it works for me. Depending on where your room is located, there can be a lot of street noise. But, I really haven't had a problem as yet. There is a great restaurant down the road with a great happy hour. I eat most of my evening meals there during happy hour. The place is called the Gourmet Cafe and Bakery. It's just across from COSTCO. I wish I had known about this place a year ago.

We stayed at Don's Turf on 8/23 & 8/24.  We were visiting Los Al (from Washington State) for the horserace meet and to celebrate my father's 75th birthday.    We used to stay at Don's Turf when I was growing up (in the 1970s and 1980s), but in the late-80's it felt into disrepair.  We hadn't stayed since, but decided to give it a try after having had a disappointing experience at the local Courtyard by Marriott, from which we departed after only one night.    The TripAdivsor reviews for Don's Turf were positive, so I felt it was worth a go.  Because the rooms were inexpensive ($75 for two double beds, or $50 for one queen), we booked two rooms.    I was very pleased to see the rooms and courtyard in great condition, but still keeping the motel's 1950's California-style charm.

Very clean, low cost, extremely quiet, and friendly staff. Good place for sleeping and resting. A no frills small motel.  The pool is very clean and sparkling clear.  About 1-2 miles down the road is restaurants and shopping places and grocery stores.

This hotel had lots of good reviews, the price was right and was near where we needed to be so we decided to give it a try. This in not a fancy resort hotel obviously but what it is a great value in a good sized, super clean and quiet room. Perfect if you have other things to do and places to go. The courtyard had has great landscaping and the pool is excellent. Not many amenities or a place to hang out all day though.  The pool area doesn't open till 9 am I believe so you only have a small chair outside your door to sit outside and drink your coffee. No coffee makers in the rooms so make other arrangement for that.

If you want a great inexpensive place to stay anywhere near Los Alamitos...this is it!!  We were looking for something near the Race Track (only 1/2 mile away)   We chose this motel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Frankly if we had driven by, we probably wouldn't have stopped because the outside is pretty boring considering the really nice area that it is in. They do  have a great sign..  Once inside..very nice! The rooms are clean though plain, no pictures on the walls, no laundry, no room service, no wi-fi..   Our room had a small fridge with small freezer, perfect for our snacks and juice. Microwave also included, no coffee maker...  We loved  that the high ceilings made the rooms seem large.   Comfortable king size bed with mattress top. Small table with two chairs.

My husband and I needed a clean, inexpensive place to lay our heads for a couple of days while we were in town for our nephew's graduation in Anaheim. I read all the good reviews here and we were definitely not disappointed. Great location, friendly front desk staff, and spotless rooms, all at an incredible price. Truly a unique place with authentic 50's lighting and furniture. The bed and linens were soft and clean as were the towels. We'll certainly stay again.

This Motel is now filed under "My Secret" I was in town for a couple of days and did not want to throw a bunch of money on a "Chain" hotel, considered an area Motel 6 but found Don' Turf Motel. I really did not know what to expect but the price was right and I really just wanted to rest and relax. I was very impressed, the room was spacious, much larger than I expected, I would almost consider it a baby brother of a Residence Inn. A mini-fridge, microwave and VERY CLEAN! If you are looking for a great no frills value then look no further! A step back in history from the outside but a very special place on the inside. I will NEVER go to a Motel 6 again when I am in the area! Give this place a chance on your next stay. It is value rich, quiet and relaxing. It should be noted that

I've now stayed at the Turf twice.  For around fifty bucks, you get a clean bed, hot shower, pool access and free parking, TV and some rooms have microwaves and/or fridges.  Just ask!  My partner left his phone in the room when we left town--and a week later, we phoned the front desk and they saved his phone for us.  We showed my ID to pick it up--no worries!  Great service.  I will stay there again.  Hope to see the butterflies in the butterfly garden when it's the right season.

This motel is cleaner than any motel I have ever seen. The pool is sparkling clean and the gardens are well kept. I would rather stay hear than any other hotel down the street. I will recommend this place to everyone and will tell people about this place. I had to stay at this motel because my apartment was not ready to moved into and I had to move out of my last place, so I stayed here. Great place and love the butterflies and humming birds that seem to live there.

This is a clean, well lighted place with comfy beds near a family reunion!  We'll be back.  The staff and service is fantastic & the clientele quiet.  There is even a hummingbird garden near the pool.

Summary Heading: If you want to stay in a clean, economical and no-frills motel, this is it.
Summary: I spent one night in this motel because I needed to stay close to my daughter's home for one night and she didn't have accommodations for me.  The motel was built in the 50's and the rooms are very clean and well maintained.  All of the rooms are situated around a courtyard that includes a  swimming pool and nice grassy area with plants and flowers.  The motel is definitely a bare-bones motel with no amenities but if you simply want a room to sleep in and don't want to pay much then this is the place for you.  The bed in my room was very comfortable but it was hard to sleep in the morning due to the fact there was no darkened drapes, only thin white drapes.  The lady at the front desk was very welcoming, caring and helpful.  This motel is located on a busy street and I was told

I stayed at Don's Turf Motel after a plumbing problem had occurred. The girl at the front desk greeted me and instantly made me feel good about staying there. She didn't mind showing me the rooms before I paid. For what people have heard they DON'T charge by the hour. I asked haha. The pool is extremely clean It's nice to lay out there. I would definitly stay there again. They don't have cable or WiFi but then again they are a MOTEL. They have regular TV with older TV sets. Nothing to complain about it's like people say don't judge a book by its cover.

Summary Heading: Don't Judge A Book By It's Cover
Summary: I live local. Needed to leave my house due to a construction emergency. Googled hotels in my area. Would have never thought of staying here except for the positive comments. I have lived in the area all my life and yes...have made snide remarks about them charging "by the hour". No, it's not the Hilton, or the Marriot's across the street but if you need a clean, inexpensive place to stay you can't beat it. There is no flat screen TV, just a basic cable "old school" television, no hair dryers, complimentary shampoos, etc. but the rooms are large and clean!! I peeked into one of the downstairs rooms and to my surprise they were furnished a bit differently than my room upstairs, with mini fridge and microwave. Maybe you get one if you request it, but for my purpose, it wasn't

Summary Heading: Better on the inside than the outside
Summary: I was a little nervous stopping by this hotel to even find out their rates. The outside looks sketchy at first. But the inside is super clean with wonderful landscaping. Ask for a room on the first floor because you get a sliding glass door to the pool and yard which we had all to ourselves. Definitley worth a look!

Summary Heading: A lot better than the outside implies!
Summary: I have lived in Los Alamitos and the surrounding area all my life and due to a plumbing emergency at my house I needed up staying here with my husband one night.  We made jokes whenever we drove by that place because it looks so 70s and crummy.  If we hadn't been desperate we wouldn't have ever gone there.  Once we got inside the room we were pleasantly surprised.  It was really clean, with new carpet and new paint.  The bed was even surprisingly comfortable.  The room was pretty basic but at $50 a night we weren't expecting much.  I hope to never have another emergency like the one that got us there but if I did I wouldn't think twice about going back.
If one is looking for great value, clean and friendly service, this is it.  This is a " old school " and " retro " place.
